summary:
INXS was an Australian rock band formed in 1977 in Sydney. The original members included the Farriss brothers (Andrew, Jon, and Tim), Garry Gary Beers, Michael Hutchence, and Kirk Pengilly. They were known for their energetic performances and a mix of new wave, pop, and rock styles.

The band gained international fame in the 1980s with hits like "Original Sin," "Need You Tonight," and "Never Tear Us Apart." After Hutchence's death in 1997, INXS continued with different lead singers. They won many awards and sold over 75 million albums worldwide.
title: INXS
